title: PHPcheckdate()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPcheckdate()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example Check if several dates are valid Gregorian dates: "; var_dump(checkdate(2,29,2003)); echo "
"; var_dump(checkdate(2,29,2004)); ?> Definition and Usage The checkdate() function is used to validate a Gregorian date. Syntax checkdate( month, day, year) Parameter Values Parameter Description month Required. Specifies the month as a number between 1 and 12 day Required. Specifies the day as a number between 1 and 31 year Required. Specifies the year as a number between 1 and 32767 Technical Details Return Value: TRUE if the date is valid. FALSE otherwise PHP Version: 4.0+ ★ +1

summary: This tutorial covers PHPcheckdate()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPcheckdate()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPcheckdate()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
